# Trading Strategy

## Goals
- Build long-term wealth through a diversified portfolio of high-quality technology stocks
- Maintain ~60% in core blue-chip tech (AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL) for stability
- Allocate ~30% to high-growth AI/semiconductor plays (NVDA, AMD, TSM)
- Reserve ~10% for speculative options plays with defined risk

## Risk Tolerance
- Medium-high: comfortable holding through 20-30% drawdowns
- Use options only for defined-risk strategies (long calls/puts, no naked shorts)
- Maximum single-position size: 25% of portfolio

## Rebalancing Rules
- Rebalance quarterly or when any position drifts >5% from target allocation
- Take partial profits when a position gains >50% from cost basis
- Cut losses if fundamentals deteriorate (not just price action)

## Options Strategy
- Buy calls only on stocks I'd be happy owning at the strike price
- Keep options exposure under 5% of total portfolio value
- Close options with >50% gain or when IV spikes (sell into fear)

## Current Focus
- Overweight AI/semiconductor sector until end of 2026
- Watch for rotation opportunities into undervalued sectors
- Keep cash reserve of at least 5% for opportunistic buys
